definition: to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to hang (down)/droop/dangle/bend down/hand down/bequeath/nearly/almost/to approach
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng

sentences.english: He ought not to have stopped his work halfway.
sentences.chinese: 他本不应该做这项事情时功败垂成。

sentences.english: This way you don't overextend your economy and then fizzle out with nothing left.
sentences.chinese: 这样你就不会开始过分发展经济，最后功败垂成了。

sentences.english: There's many a slip between the cup and the lip! Who knows what may happen.
sentences.chinese: 事情往往功败垂成，谁知道将会发生什么。

sentences.english: Any close to was not answered correctly, likely suffer defeat on the verge of victory.
sentences.chinese: 任何一关没有正确应对，都可能功败垂成。

definition: lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
basket for carrying soil
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
fall (of an empire)
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
to be defeated and dispersed
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to return without any achievement (idiom); to go home with one's tail between one's legs
variant of 殞命|殒命[yun3 ming4]/to die/to perish
to lose Jingzhou due to carelessness (idiom)/to suffer a major setback due to negligence
to miscalculate/miscalculation
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4
